name: Apotheon Arena
description: Apotheon Arena is the free online-multiplayer complement to the mythic Greek action RPG, Apotheon. Pit your skills with spear and shield against other players in brutal bronze-age combat. Battle across the statuesque arenas of Olympus, depicted with beautiful black-figure pottery artwork.
minimum_requirements: OS: XP/Vista/Windows 7 Processor: Dual-core processor (Intel Dual Core 2.0 GHz or AMD Athlon X2 5200+ 2.6 GHz) Memory: 1 GB RAM Graphics: DirectX 9.0c compatible DirectX: Version 9.0c Network: Broadband Internet connection Storage: 1 GB available space Sound Card: DirectX 9.0c compatible sound cards

reviews.review_text: Well I must say, as an advertisement for the single-player 'parent' game, Apotheon, this certainly makes quite the impression (though I'm not entirely sure why it states that this one can also be played single-player, when it seems that only the tutorial can be tackled in such a way)! Visually stunning, really nice 'n' natural-feeling controls, solid sound...there's not much to complain about here. Especially for FREE.   I can only suspect that it's even 'better' in multiplayer, as that's what it's clearly intended for, but alas: a. No one else in Australia seems to be playing it right at this very moment (it is, in all fairness, 3.30 in the morning), and b. I generally couldn't be arsed with multiplayer games anyway, especially with strangers. I'll definitely buy the aforementioned single-player game on the strength of this, though, and wouldn't hesitate to recommend this to all you people out there - all several BILLION of you, far as I can tell - who do indeed enjoy the multiplayer experience.    A thoroughly excellent side-scrolling beat-'em-up, whichever way you look at it.  Verdict: 8.5/10.
